page.title: 15Transport
page.content: The A384 is the only main road which borders the block on the north. Minor roads connect Moortown and Plaster Down, one road running through Sampford Spiney. This forks just below the church, both branching out onto the moor, joining a road leading across open moorland into Tavistock. Longash, Daveytown and Parktown are linked by a bridlepath from the A384 at Merrivale. Vixen Tor Cottages, Heckwood HOuse and Hecklake are reached along a track which the residents maintain themselves, enabling them to reach Tavistock or other built-up areas by way of Sampford Spiney. Hence everyone relies upon the use of a motor vehicle for contact with shops and entertainment. The only car parks are small ones at intervals on the A384 designated by the Dartmoor National Park.
